thread.title: Miranda Hart brings her 'two mums' to Gogglebox celebrity special
thread.title_full: Miranda Hart brings her 'two mums' to Gogglebox celebrity special

title: Miranda Hart brings her 'two mums' to Gogglebox celebrity special
text:
Miranda Hart brings her 'two mums' to Gogglebox celebrity special Miranda Hart brings her 'two mums' to Gogglebox celebrity special 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Miranda Hart’s sitcom alter ego loves nothing more than sitting on the sofa watching the telly with her friends Stevie and Gary. 
But though Miranda may have come to an end in January, fans will be able to see its star back in front of the TV for a Gogglebox celebrity special with two of the most important women in her life – on-screen mother Patricia Hodge (who played Penny) and her real mother, Diana Hart-Dyke. Miranda Hart and Sarah Hadland toast the end of Miranda (BBC/Shine TV) 
It should be a fun evening for the comedian, who starred in the 2014 celebrity special. This year she will have to explain to her mother who Strictly star Peter Andre is. 
In a 2011 interview in the Evening Standard, the 42-year-old described herself as“living and breathing light entertainment” and said Strictly Come Dancing was her “religion”. 
She added: “I do love to cry. I’ll cry at the drop of a hat. I’ll cry at your basic television programme, let alone a weepie.” 
But she was less of a fan of the news, saying she “can’t face watching it sometimes. It’s always so miserable. I live in a bit of a news vacuum actually.” Jamie Dornan and Nick Frost on Celebrity Gogglebox (Channel 4) 
Jamie Dornan and Nick Frost will also be having a night in to chat about what’s on telly. 
They will join Boy George and Geri Halliwell as the stars of Gogglebox: Stand Up To Cancer, which is part of the channel’s programming in support of Cancer Research UK. Boy George, Marilyn and Geri Halliwell in Gogglebox’s celebrity episode (Channel 4) 
Presenter Anthea Turner and X Factor winner Alexandra Burke have also been confirmed as stars of Celebrity First Dates, where they will go on real-life blind dates in an attempt to find love. Share article 
Gogglebox: Stand Up To Cancer airs on Friday, October 9 at 9pm on Channel 4. Celebrity First Dates airs on Monday, October 12 at 9pm. Promoted Stories
